III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff person 1 punched Youth A in the nose giving him a
nosebleed.
Investigation Complainant
I spoke with the Complainant on 02/10/2023. Complainant is a
staff person and requested to remain anonymous.
Youth A
Youth A was placed at Mandy’s Place at Oakland County
Children’s Village on 12/17/2022. I interviewed Youth A face to
face at Mandy’s Place on 02/10/2023 with another Department of
Health and Human Service worker. Youth A stated he does not
know why he often gets nosebleeds. Youth A stated he does not
get along with Staff person 1 because he is strict. Youth A stated
there was an incident when he left the building and tried to get
over a fence to go visit his mother. Youth A stated Staff person 1
restrained him and punched him in the nose causing his nose to
bleed. Youth A stated the punch did not hurt and Staff person 4
gave him tissues for his nosebleed. I did not observe any marks or
swelling on Youth A’s nose or face.
I attempted to reach Youth A’s Department of Health and Human
Service worker on 02/27/2023 and 03/02/2023.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B face to face at Mandy’s Place on
02/10/2023 with another Department of Health and Human
Service worker. Youth B was randomly selected for an interview
because she resides at Mandy’s Place. Youth B stated Staff
person 1 is respectful and redirects a youth when needed. Youth
B stated Staff person 1 does not restrain a youth without reason.
Youth B stated she has never seen Staff person 1 hit or punch a
youth. Youth B stated Youth A is agitated and screaming more
lately. Youth B stated she witnessed Youth A swing at Staff
person 1 in West hallway sometime this week, but there was no
contact between Youth A and Staff person 1.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 face to face at Oakland County
Children Village on 02/10/2023 with another Department of Health
2

and Human Service worker. Staff person 1 stated in the past
several days Youth A has become more agitated and aggressive
due to a recent medication change. Staff person 1 described the
behavior of Youth A as trying to reach for staff keys, spitting, and
invading personal boundaries. Staff person 1 stated Youth A
swung a yo-yo, playing around the world, on the unit on
02/06/2023. Staff person 1 stated Youth A became agitated when
redirected and walked outside. Staff person 1 stated he and Staff
person 2 and Staff person 3 shadowed Youth A outside to the
playground. Staff person 1 stated Youth A made aggressive
postures, but did not strike out. Staff person 1 stated Youth A
yelled and threw a snowball. Staff person 1 stated Youth A’s nose
began to bleed and Supervisor 1 gave Youth A some tissue. Staff
person 1 stated he did not have physical contact with Youth A
during this incident. Staff person 1 stated he and the other staff
followed Youth A back to the unit and Youth A became aggressive
again on West hallway and his nose began to bleed again. Staff
person 1 stated he directed Youth A to back up and nothing
further happened.
Staff person 2
I interviewed Staff person 2 face to face at Oakland County
Children Village on 02/10/2023. Staff person 2 stated she and
Staff person 1 and 3 shadowed Youth A outside on 02/06/2023
and Youth A did not comply with verbal redirection to return to the
building. Staff person 2 stated Supervisor 1 responded to the
assistance call and provided Youth A with tissue from his truck
when Youth A’s nose began to bleed out of the blue. Staff person
2 stated Youth A remained worked up as he walked back to the
unit. Staff person 2 stated Youth A picked up snow and threw it
while yelling at Staff person 1. Staff person 2 stated she did not
witness any physical contact between Youth A and Staff person 1
during this incident. Staff person 2 stated she did not see any
marks or swelling on Youth A’s face.
Staff person 3
I interviewed Staff person 3 by telephone on 03/01/2023. Staff
person 3 stated he shadowed Youth A outside with Staff person 1
and Staff person 2. Staff person 3 stated Youth A walked to the
entrance gate and pulled at the metal gate trying to leave. Staff
person 3 stated Youth A was verbally redirected to return to the
unit, but refused. Staff person 3 stated Youth A got a sudden
nosebleed. Staff person 3 stated Supervisor 1 arrived earlier in
this situation and went to his truck and got tissue for Youth A. Staff
person 3 stated Youth A walked back to Mandy’s Place on his
own. Staff person 3 stated Youth A was counseled to reintegrate
3

back into program once inside Mandy’s Place. Staff person 3
stated Staff person 1 did not have physical contact with Youth A.
Staff person 4
I interviewed Staff person 4 by telephone on 02/27/2023 because
Youth A mentioned him in his interview. Staff person 4 stated he
was not involved in the incident when Youth A was outside by the
entrance gate. Staff person 4 stated he has never witnessed a
staff person hitting Youth A in the face. Staff person 4 stated he
has never seen swelling or bruises on Youth A’s face. Staff person
4 stated Youth A gets nosebleeds, but has started using a nasal
spray that seems to decrease his nosebleeds.
Supervisor 1
I interviewed Supervisor 1 by telephone on 02/28/2023.
Supervisor 1 stated he stopped his truck and saw Staff person 1,
Staff person 2, and Staff person 3 standing by Youth A next to the
parking lot. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was trying to leave the
grounds. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A became angry and made an
agonizing sound which led to his right nostril nosebleed.
Supervisor 1 stated he went to his truck and returned with a travel
size tissue package and gave it to Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated
Youth A agreed to go back to the building and staff shadowed
Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated he later saw Youth A inside Mandy’s
Place and Youth A was jovial playing with a bean bag without
injury to his face. Supervisor 1 stated no one hit or restrained
Youth A to cause his nose to bleed.
Video documentation
Video tape documentation was reviewed at Oakland County
Children Village on 02/06/2023. Another Department of Health
and Human Service worker forwarded additional video footage on
02/23/2023. Video tape footage shows Youth A outside walking
and Staff person 1, Staff person 2, and Staff person 3 following
behind at a distance, but within line of sight. It shows Youth A
walking back to the building and then turning around and walking
towards the fence. It shows a pick-up truck arrives and Supervisor
1 gets out and joins the staff standing near Youth A. It shows
Supervisor 1 going to the truck and returning to Youth A and the
other staff. It shows Youth A walking back to Mandy’s Place and
staff following within line of sight. It shows Youth A picks up some
snow and throws it at Mandy’s Place. It shows Youth A enters
Mandy’s Place and staff continue to follow Youth A. Inside
Mandy’s Place the video footage shows Youth A in West hallway.
Youth A is not touching his face and is not seen with any injury to
his face.
4

Documentation
Nursing notes state Youth A’s medications were changed by the
psychiatrist on 02/02/2023.
Nursing note states Youth A had a nosebleed on 02/06/2023 and
02/07/2023. Youth A was educated on nosebleed prevention and
what to do during a nosebleed. Nurse ordered saline mist.
Staff person 1 has been employed at Oakland County Children
Village since 07/2006 and does not have a discipline history.
Another Department of Health and Human Service worker
completed an investigation without finding.
Analysis Youth A stated Staff person 1 punched his nose and caused a
nosebleed. Staff person 1 denies hitting Youth A. Staff person 2,
Staff person 3, and Supervisor 1 were present during all or part of
the incident and stated Staff person 1 did not have physical
contact with Youth A. Video review did not show physical contact
between Youth A and Staff person 1. It is found that Staff person
1 did not punch Youth A in the nose and cause Youth A’s
nosebleed.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
